Dialogue.Line: If you could just open the door.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Borusa goes inside just before the Sontarans run into the room. They start firing their rheon carbines at the Tardis.
At the forcefield control box that the Doctor had been jury-rigging.

Dialogue.Line: Well?
Well, it's difficult. There's so much disorder.
I must have reinforcements.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kelner examines an intact panel nearby.

Dialogue.Line: There is a way of patching control through.
What do you do?
I'm a technician.
Good. You stand there. Andred, control booth seven, on the right. K9, go with him. Off you go.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Andred and K9 go deeper into the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Leela.
Yes?
Show Borusa to the VIP suite.
VIP suite?
The Chancellor's suite. It's down there on the left, up three stages, one down stage, turn left, turn left, turn left, turn left again. The room's marked no entry. Off you go.
No entry.
Leela?
Yes?
Take that for me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He gives her the Great Key.

Dialogue.Line: (sotto) You can't give the Great Key to an alien.
I just have.
You trust her?
I do. Leela, that's important.
Then I shall look after it.
Good. Off you go.
Come.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela and Borusa leave.

Dialogue.Line: What's your name?
Rodan.
Rodan. R O D A N. How do you do, Rodan?
As well as I can, Excellency.
Well, who could hope for more. What branch did you study?
Quasitronics.
Quasitronics. I don't know much about quasitronics.
Well, it's a simple field study exercise
Yes, I'm sure it is a simple field study exercise. You wouldn't have a glimmer of astrophysics, would you?
A glimmer.
Good. Could you forget everything you ever learned?
What?
I mean, could you switch my primary and secondary stabiliser circuitry into your secondary defence barrier?
Link your control to the main defence mechanism?
Well, to close the hole I made in it, yes. Seal it up and stop any more Sontaran ships coming in.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Rodan thinks for a moment, then

Dialogue.Line: Have you got a screwdriver?
How much longer?
I can't get, oh.
My battalion commander insists on immediate entry. Unless I obey, I shall die. Before I die, you will die, Time Lord.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Rodan is working inside the console. The Doctor hands her tools as needed.

Dialogue.Line: You all right?
Of course I am.
Good.
Crimps.
Crimps. Crimps. Are you sure you know what you're doing?
I do. Five four two lever.
Five four two lever. Five four two lever.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Something creaks.

Dialogue.Line: Steady, old girl. This won't hurt a bit.
Useless.
What is of no use?
The primary, secondary and tertiary control circuits are out of order.
Then repair them.
It isn't a question of repair, Excellency. They have been bypassed. The only way of doing that is through a time capsule, and the only one in operation at the moment is the President's.
Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Frustrated, Stor slams his hand through the panel Kelner was trying to work on. It burns out.

Dialogue.Line: They could rampage right through the whole universe. And not just this universe, all the universes. Nasty thought, isn't it? That's why I had to stop them. Just had to.
Winklegruber.
Winklegruber? Are you listening to what I was saying?
A Winklegruber.
Winklegruber.
No, now what were you saying?

I was saying that what they're after is the Rod of Rassilon, the Sash, and above all, the Great Key. These three together, linked into the Matrix, provide the sum total of Time Lord power. That's what they want.
There is an alternative, Excellency.
What is it?
I believe I can bypass the safety circuits.
Hand.
Hand.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor helps Rodan stand up.

Dialogue.Line: Load of junk.
What is?
This.
It's my Tardis you're talking about.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Rodan activates the scanner.

Dialogue.Line: There you are. Look, there's the arrow head, arrow wings, arrow shaft. Why, it's a perfect Sontaran formation.
Yes. Why an entire battle fleet?
Doesn't matter. The defence screens are up again.
Huh, you haven't seen what a Sontaran battle fleet. Are you sure?
Shush. As long as this Tardis remains secure, you control the defence screens.
As long as the Tardis remains secure.
Better. Much better, Time Lord.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kelner throws switches and levers on an intact piece of equipment.
Everything goes negative. Leela rushes in.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor! Doctor!
Get Rodan.
Rodan?
Get Rodan.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela pulls the Doctor to his feet and he rushes out of the console room, where he throws a switch on the wall.

Dialogue.Line: What has happened?
He has stabilised, thrown the fail-safe switch in his time capsule.
With what effect?
The capsule is fixed in its present state for eternity, until he throws off the fail-safe switch.
So he is trapped?
Yes, Excellency. The Great Key. I could have done so much with the Great Key.
No one may enter or leave this solid-state capsule?
I have entrance probes for all time capsules, sir.
Bring the relevant probe with you.
Quick, lock the door.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela puts a big bar across the door. The Doctor takes a component from the wall panel.

Dialogue.Line: Without that, no one can reset the systems. Where are the others?
In the bathroom.
The bathroom?
Yes, in the bathroom.
You got lost, didn't you.
Well, it's bigger than it looks, your Tardis.
Ah no, the mighty huntress got her. Don't you think she got lost?
I didn't. How do you know?
I think you got lost.
Listen, Doctor, you gave me the wrong directions.
Come on. You got lost.
How could you possibly expect me to follow those directions?
You got lost!
Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stor enters with one warrior and Kelner. He removes his helmet.

Dialogue.Line: This machine is a load of obsolete rubbish.
This model was withdrawn centuries ago.
Make the systems function again.
But, but I'm not an engineer, sir. I
Make it work, or you'll die. Well?
He has fastened it with some kind of locking device from the other side, sir.
He's trapped in here now, and this is the only way out.
I will open it, sir. Then we shall have them.
He has the Great Key. I want him captured, intact but unharmed. After that, I will deal with him personally.
All right, let's walk. I've got a wonderful sense of direction. I've got a perfect sense of direction.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor stops, then goes down the steps.

Dialogue.Line: I thought you said you had a good
Shush. Where are we?
Storeroom twenty three A.
Where are we going?
The workshop.
Has he got a workshop on board?
Of course I have. Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Identical location to 23A.

Dialogue.Line: What nobody understands is, the advantage of my antiquated Tardis is that it's fully equipped and completely reliable.
Completely?
Yes. Yeah, well, almost completely.
Where are we now?
Service tunnel, Blue Section two five. Everything's going to be all right. You just follow me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: And into an identical area to storeroom 23A again and down the steps. Running joke.

Dialogue.Line: Odd. I could have sworn I've been here before.
We have.
Oh. Oh. I must be in level twenty three B.
Well, wherever we are, it could do with a lick of paint.
Lick of paint?
Yes, clean it up a bit. You know, redecoration.
Listen, I'm a Time Lord, not a painter and decorator. I'm preoccupied with (pause)
Sontarans?
Yes. Sontarans, Daleks.
Don't get excited.
What did you say?
I said, don't get excited.
I'm not getting excited. I'm not getting
(sotto) Doctor!
(sotto) What is it?
You are getting excited.
No, I'm not.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela steps on the Doctor's scarf.

Dialogue.Line: Would you get off my scarf, please.
Doctor, we've been here before.
Nonsense.
Déjà vu.
Déjà what?
Déjà vu. It's a common thing among time travellers.
There you are.
We have been here before.
Rodan, tell her she's wrong.
Doctor, she's absolutely right.
What?
We just travelled this route ten minutes ago.
Nonsense. I know this Tardis like the back of my hand.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor stares at his right palm. Leela turns his hand over for him.

Dialogue.Line: Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor taps the sundial on the wall.

Dialogue.Line: That clock's slow.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Up in the console room, the Sontaran warrior brings in a rifle-sized weapon to use on the locked inner door. The Doctor, Rodan and Leela are sitting on white painted cast iron seats.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, we can't sit around here all day.
You said you wanted a rest.
I've just had one. Let's go and find K9.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: K9 is wired up to some equipment whilst wearing the circlet, and Andred is just watching.

Dialogue.Line: If I had a dog like you in my unit, I'd make him a sergeant.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Again.

Dialogue.Line: Why you can't use a perfectly modern seven oh six model, I'll never understand.
No character.
Doctor.
Yes?
We have been here before.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela sits on the steps and folds her arms.

Dialogue.Line: Nonsense. Rear area now, storeroom fourteen D. Onward!
It's impossible, sir.
Why?
Well, it's obvious. You see, the Doctor has removed the primary refraction tube from his fail-safe controls. With that circuit broken, well, no one can reactivate the Tardis.
So I cannot destroy the Tardis and the Doctor cannot escape? Stalemate.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The bar across the inner door finally burns in two and falls.

Dialogue.Line: Hello. boy. How's it going? K9: Nothing is going anywhere, master. A state of perfect inertia.
I know we're not going anywhere. I don't like the idea of inertia being perfect.
Little K9.
Is it clear?
At full capacity, Excellency, just as you ordered.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An alarm sounds.

Dialogue.Line: What is it?
Early warning. Something's broken in upstairs.
We will do battle on your own ground, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stor puts his helmet back on.

Dialogue.Line: Master.
Leela, the key I gave you.
Of course.
Can I have it, please? Thank you. Rodan, look at me. You are now in a state of deep hypnosis. Can you hear me?
Yes.
Rodan, you will help K9. You will do whatever he tells you. When K9 asks you for this key, you will give it to him. You will not give the key to anyone else. You understand?
Yes.
Good. Watch the door. Come on. We're relying on you, K9. K9: Master.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Andred and Leela leave.

Dialogue.Line: One rod of type three iridium alloy, one metre in length.
Coming up.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Going downwards, still.

Dialogue.Line: Sorry the lift's out of order. Shush.
What did you say?
I said I'm sorry the lift's out of order.
Oh. Where are we going?
What? To the bathroom of course.
To the bathroom?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stor uses a tracer on his comm. unit to try and find something.

Dialogue.Line: Very clever, Doctor.
What is it, sir?
The Doctor has set up a biological barrage. My instruments cannot trace human life forms. We must return to his control room and eliminate this barrier.
Wait, sir. There is another way. If I can trace the ancillary generator that powers this barrier
Can you do this?
I believe I can, sir.
Then you will be well rewarded. Lead on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Borusa is reading the Daily Mirror from Tuesday April 16 1912 - lead story the sinking of the Titanic - and drinking a blue cocktail through a fancy curled straw.

Dialogue.Line: I've kept you waiting, Chancellor. I've kept you waiting, Chancellor.
I'm quite comfortable, thank you.
Good.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Borusa hands him the newspaper.

Dialogue.Line: I had nothing to do with this, I promise you. Chancellor, you know about the Rod of Rassilon.
Yes.
And you know about the Sash of Rassilon.
Yes.
And especially, you know about the Great Key.
Yes.
Therefore, it would be very bad for us if you were to fall into the hands of the Sontarans. No breeding, you see.
It's not just a question of breeding, surely?
Oh, but it is, it is, I assure you, Chancellor, it is. They're a cloned species, you see. They can multiply at the rate of a million every four minutes. Shall we go?
I think so.
Good. _**[Tardis storeroom]** _ _(Kelner leads Stor and his aide in and up the short flight of steps, then stops.)
Well?
Tangential formation has been quite altered. The Doctor has made many modifications over the centuries. We should be by now
Which way?
Through here. _
Here, I'm sure of it._

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Borusa have gone when Stor, Kelner and the Sontaran enter. Andred throws a pool chair at the Sontaran, knocking him off balance and almost into the water before running off.

Dialogue.Line: Pick a door, any door. Ready? Leave.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Borusa goes through one door, Leela and Andred another, and the Doctor takes one on the other side of the passageway.
They all meet up at the entrance to a hospital ward, with curtains across cubicles. Leela gasps at seeing the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: Come on.
I wish you'd stabilise your pedestrian infrastructure, President.
What? Come on, pull yourself together, Borusa. Hello, sickbay. Quick, curtains. Lock the door, Andred.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stor arrives outside and looks through the glass panel in the door. He puts his fist through the glass and unlocks the door. Rheon carbine in hand, they move slowly along the room, pulling back each cubicle curtain as they go. Andred is behind one, but Stor does not see him. Instead he starts firing his weapon in frustration, catching Andred's right arm, and leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Let's get out of here.
You go on. I'll hold them off.
With what? We must catch the others. We'll go my way. Come on.
What is it?
Sorry about this. I'm not going to be much good to you now.
Leela?
Yes?
Take these two back to the workshop. You know the way.
Well, as well as I did last time.
It's along there on the left. Second on the left, up two stages
Don't worry, Doctor. I'll find my own way.
Good. Bye, bye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor hides in the lush foliage.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, no.
Where are we?
Déjà vu. Back where we started.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: In the swimming pool, the Doctor makes bird calls, prompting a frustrated Sontaran to fire wildly, then step backwards into the clutches of a giant carnivorous plant. With only his arm sticking out of the clam-like lips, he drops his carbine. The Doctor shakes his hand as he leaves.

Dialogue.Line: This is useless! Where is the ancillary power unit?
I don't know.
What?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stor takes out his weapon.

Dialogue.Line: Wait! Perhaps the Doctor is individual.
That is a weakness. Only through unity is there strength.
He has hidden it, I think.
Where?
I believe I begin to understand the Doctor.
I doubt that.
It is a utilitarian unit. He would disguise it with beauty. _
Come on, Doctor. You've got a perfect sense of direction.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kelner and Stor enter the swimming pool area. The Doctor whistles Colonel Bogey as he goes along a service passage.
Stor releases his minion from the carnivorous plant.

Dialogue.Line: I could not
Explanations will wait. My orders are clear. You will follow this fool and destroy the power unit he will show you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stor removes his helmet.

Dialogue.Line: I have other duties.
Doctor.
Yes.
Have you defeated them?
No. We've got to get to the workshop.
Workshop?
Yes, the workshop. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: While Stor stomps off on his own, Kelner and the Sontaran arrive at a corridor lined with paintings, and the Venus de Milo at one end. Kelner looks at the Arnolfini portrait.

Dialogue.Line: How beautiful.
What is this place?
Ancillary power station.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kelner goes back to the Venus, and feels his way down her left leg until he finds a hidden switch. Whirring, and the artworks vanish. Kelner returns to where the Van Eyck painting had hung, opens a clear plastic box on the wall and removes the circuit breaker.

Dialogue.Line: Now, try your tracer.
The humanoids are three levels below.
Finished?
Yes, it's finished.
Where is it?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Rodan points across the room.

Dialogue.Line: Give me the key. Wake up, Rodan. Give me the key.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor crosses the room, picks up a hefty weapon with three cylinders and an arrowhead muzzle on the end and puts it on a table.

Dialogue.Line: What is it?
No!
You know how helpless we are against the Sontarans.
I forbid you to use it. You should never have constructed it.
But what is it?
It's the ultimate weapon. The Demat gun.
That's impossible!
You built in under hypnosis. But how to arm it, hmm? Is that why the Key remained hidden for so long?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor places the Great Key into a chamber behind the cylinders, and they light up.

Dialogue.Line: I could rule the universe with this, Chancellor.
Is that what you want? Destroy that gun. Destroy all knowledge of it. It'll throw us back to the darkest age!
No, Chancellor, forward.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor fires the Demat gun whilst it is still on the table. The Sontaran vanishes. Leela runs to Kelner and puts her knife to his throat.

Dialogue.Line: No, wait, wait, Leela! Don't kill him! Kelner, where's Stor? Kill him.
No! No! He's in the Panopticon.
The? Borusa, the Matrix.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: _Stor stalks along a service corridor. The Doctor appears carrying the Demat gun. In true farce fashion, they keep missing each other at junctions until the Doctor ends up tailing him._ They both leave the Tardis.
Stor climbs onto the dais.

Dialogue.Line: Hold it, Stor.
Doctor. This grenade will give me a lot of pleasure.
You'll destroy us all.
Yes. It is a glory to die for a glorious Sontaran empire.
But you'll destroy this entire galaxy.
Yes, and all of the Time Lords with it.
And your battlefield.

Yes, Doctor. But it is a small price to pay. If we cannot control the power of the Time Lords, then we shall destroy it. Goodbye, Doctor. (The Doctor Demats Stor. There is a blinding flash and we next see the Doctor lying on the floor of the Panopticon. The Demat gun is gone, and only the Great Key remains.
Leela, listen.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Slow, heavy footsteps approach.

Dialogue.Line: Hello, Leela.
Oh, Doctor.
Put it away. Borusa, what are you doing here?
Your Excellence.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kelner sinks to his knees.

Dialogue.Line: Excellence? Excellence?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor looks down and sees that he is wearing the Sash.

Dialogue.Line: Is this some kind of a joke, Borusa? It's not like you to make jokes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Borusa takes the Sash from the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: Have you forgotten your induction?
My induction?
The Vardans?
(sotto) Vardans.
The Sontarans?
(sotto) Sontarans.
Doctor, you saved Gallifrey.
I have? Oh. Well, what do you think of that, Leela?
I think you've gone mad.
He remembers nothing of it. It is the wisdom of Rassilon.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor enters to applause from the cast and goes straight to the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Well, ta-ta, everybody. Come on, Leela. Come on. What's the matter?
I'm staying.
What? Staying? Here? Why?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela takes Andred's hand.

Dialogue.Line: Ah, I see.
I hope that
Yes, I'm sure you do hope. She'll look after you. She's terribly good with a knife. Come on, K9. K9: Negative. I remain.
Here? K9: Affirmative.
Why? K9: To look after the mistress.
Doctor?
Yes?
I will miss you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor smiles and shuts the Tardis door on them all.
He leans against the door for a moment.

Dialogue.Line: I'll miss you too, savage.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis dematerialises.

Dialogue.Line: Where will he go now, I wonder.
Somewhere else.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor pushes a large cardboard box into the console room.

Dialogue.Line: Will he be lonely, K9? K9: Insufficient data, mistress.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela and K9 bow their heads. The large cardboard box in the console room is labelled K9 Mk II. The Doctor grins at the camera.
